### 1) Top Themes
- Expansion and innovations in offshore wind capacity
- Growth and deployment trends in solar PV markets globally

### 2) Top Stories
- Finnish police have seized a ship accused of cutting a subsea cable and detained its Russian crew. (Source: datacenterdynamics.com)  
- China continues leading in offshore wind turbine single-unit capacity; Vestas has installed a 15 MW turbine at offshore wind farms. (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- UK solar is projected for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployment in 2026, signaling significant growth in solar capacity. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- US solar market is on track to reach nearly 738 GW of installed capacity by 2035. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- China solar manufacturer Eging faces a potential exit from a flagship PV project, indicating challenges in the Chinese solar sector. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Apollo has become a co-owner of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, marking investment activity in large-scale renewables. (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- A US state utility was ordered to enable flexible grid connections specifically to support community solar initiatives. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- A new digital twin for floating PV applications has been developed using artificial intelligence, enhancing remote monitoring and efficiency. (Source: pv-magazine.com)

### 3) Sector Takeaways

**Grid / Transmission**  
- Flexible grid connections are being mandated to support community solar growth, highlighting ongoing grid modernization efforts. (pv-magazine.com)  
- Security risks to subsea cables are underscored by the Finnish police detaining a ship accused of damaging critical infrastructure. (datacenterdynamics.com)

**Renewables & Storage**  
- Offshore wind capacity expands with China leading in turbine size and Vestas deploying 15 MW turbines, reflecting technological advancement. (offshorewind.biz)  
- Solar PV markets in the UK, US, India, and China show significant expansion, with record CfD deployments, projected capacity growth, and pricing dynamics shaping the sector. (pv-magazine.com)  
- Investment activities continue, with Apollo joining Hornsea 3 ownership, emphasizing confidence in large offshore projects. (offshorewind.biz)  
- AI-enabled digital twins for floating PV applications demonstrate integration of advanced tech for optimizing renewables performance. (pv-magazine.com)

**Data Centers & AI**  
- AI applications are noted both in energy sector monitoring (floating PV digital twin) and as a strategic economic factor to watch in 2026. However, details on chip or data center-specific developments are minimal. (pv-magazine.com, CNBC Television)
